paper.title: Complexity classification of truth maintenance systems
paper.venue: Symposium on Theoretical Aspects of Computer Science
paper.abstract: Truth Maintenance (TM) has been an active area of AI research in recent years. This paper addresses the computational foundations of TM and presents the classification of the computational complexity of the basic existing types of Truth Maintenance Systems (TMSu0027s). Our results include the proof of Σ 2 p -completeness of the Clause Maintenance Systemu0027s computation task. This is the first problem in artificial intelligence proved to be Σ 2 p -complete. It is likely to provide a basis for reductions proving Σ 2 p -completeness of other problems in logic and AI. As part of the proof we prove the Σ 2 p -completeness of the Generalized Node Deletion Problem, one of the first natural graph problems to be complete for any intermediate slot of the polynomial hierarchy. We also prove the equivalence of Boolean Constraint Propagation-based approaches (LTMSu0027s) and the justification-based approaches (JTMSu0027s) to TM.
